Posts.Content: I had 3 biopsies before they found my PC. PSA never went over 1.9. Having the biopsy and subsequent treatment most likely saved my life. The biopsies aren't that bad if you have a good doctor. I'm 52.
Posts.Title: Do I need a biopsy?

Posts.Content: I had 3 biopsies before they found my PC. PSA never went over 1.9. Having the biopsy and subsequent treatment most likely saved my life. The biopsies aren't that bad if you have a good doctor. I'm 52.
Posts.Title: Do I need a biopsy?

Posts.Content: I was walking 3-4 times a day sometimes a mile or more while I still had the catheter in after a couple days. Walking is good. I went back to work 4 days after surgery. Just wore loose pants and the leg bag. No lifting or twisting is the restriction they gave me. I have a desk job. After they remove the catheter, leaking can be the problem but pads usualy take care of that. I didn't leak much at all (just when I strained) and now hardly anything. When I found out guys were getting 6 weeks off I was kinda bummed I didn't do that. Would have been a nice vacation And, you might get that personal nurse thing 4 weeks after surgery should be fine for a new job if you don't have any issues or complications.

Posts.Title: 54 years old...

Posts.Content: Sorry you had to join the club but welcome. You're in good company here. I'm a couple months out of surgery with about the same stats as you and 52 years old. You should be fine but everyone told me that as well. Couldn't really believe it until I went through the experience myself. I can say I don't have any trouble with incontinance or ED at this point and other than a couple little scars I wouldn't know anything was ever wrong. I tell folks the scars are old bullet wounds from the war You'll get lots of good advice here and support. Looking back, the crap going on in my head when I heard the word cancer was way worse than any of the treatment. If your wife wants to get ya a nurse and she's hot I'd say go for it !!! Mine quit waitin on me after a week or so Good luck with your journey and keep us updated.

Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: Cath is out and no problems. Peeing good and minor incontinance so far. Now to finish the heeling Yay!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: X2 on what mkane said. Having a good woman behind you can make a huge difference. Open / honest discussion is critical.
Posts.Title: Surgery getting closer

Posts.Content: Thanks Guys 1st PSA is at 6 weeks.
Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Rudyh Sure feels good to get that catheter. I'm little over a week with it out myself. Question for ya,when you say a little innocence about how much. At first i was about two pads but feeling better and doing more i seem to leak more. Plus yesterday I started to notice a little bit of blood dripping. Not sure if i'm over doing it. Seems like if I cough or strain and don't think to tighten up first I get a little squirt. Hardly any otherwise. I used about half a pad last night. My first night without the cath. I went to bed prepared though. I had a pad, depends and a flat pad on the bed just in case. Got up to pee once during the night. The bed pad and depends were dry and the pad I put inside the depends was not too full. Just wearing a pad today. No depends to see how that goes. Walked 3 times yesterday. Longest was about a mile. The walks felt great.
Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: Cath is out and no problems. Peeing good and minor incontinance so far. Now to finish the heeling Yay!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Week 2 Update

Posts.Content: Welcome to the club. I'm 2 weeks post surgery. Not as qualified as others to speak to your fathers possible outcome but from what I do know it looks like it's still early enough for a good outcome. I can certainly address the the emotional roller coaster you are on and will be going through as it's very fresh in my mind. It's inevitable you and your father will experience a wide range of emotions until he joins us on the otherside. This is perfectly normal and will settle in time as you choose a treatment and proceed. Try not to spend too much time reading negative stuff on the internet. I found that ultimately I only came here for comfort and information and spoke with my doctor. These guys are great. Don't be shy about asking any questions and sharing what's going on no matter how silly it may seem. You will get answers and experience from guys that have gone through exactly what you're going through. Hang in there and keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Father newly diagnosed ....

Posts.Content: First off welcome What I can tell ya is that my PSA never went over 1.9 and actually went down to 1.4 before surgery. DRE felt nodules and ordered biopsy. It wasn't unitl about 2 years went by and on the 3rd biopsy that they found PC. Had surgery this past April and all appears to be good so far.

Posts.Title: We just got home from seeing my tests results;

Posts.Content: I've always gotten the PSA (diagnostic) test which gives the 3 digit result. So you may want to ask for the diagnostic PSA test.
Posts.Title: PSA Test

Posts.Content: My doc first gave me Cialis after surgery. I took it for a couple days but was having too many muscle pains so I stopped. I haven't had an ED problem since surgery but doc says it would be good to try and take something just to help healing for awhile at least. He gave me a perscription for Viagra now. I forgot to ask what dosage I should cut them into. Either 1/2 or 1/4? What are you guys doing? They don't cut very well but 1/4 would last longer. Also, what's the rules on drinking when takin this stuff? Thanks jim
Posts.Title: Viagra Question

Posts.Content: Personally, I think he's making the right decision. I'm on my 4th week out of the same surgery. I'm 52 and my scores were lower than your husbands with the exception of 1 core being a 7. Recovery is going fine. Having the PC gone has all but removed any cancer anxiety. Based on where I'm at now at 4 weeks I expect to fully recover with "NO" side effects in a relatively short period of time. At your husbands age, he has a very good chance of having a similar outcome with the word "cured" in his future. Just make sure he has the best surgeon possible with at the very least 300 surgeries under his belt. 1,000 would be even better. Good Luck jim

Posts.Content: DaVinci for me. Back to work fulltime week 2. Did some work about 4 days after surgery. I do work at computer though. I think I would go crazy sittin around for 6 weeks. I'm on week six now.

Posts.Content: I know I always got my PSA done the week before the doctor visit if that helps.
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: X3 - I use the Depends Guards and boxer briefs.
Posts.Title: What's your preference?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by MarkG OK. It's been almost a week using Tena, and, so far, I like them. Also bought some boxer briefs, great support, which helps with the comfort level. So, as of today, I think I prefer Tena over Depends. Hmm. Just read my post, and it got me thinking..... a couple of months ago I couldn't have imagined sitting here discussing the pro and cons of incontinence pads. Ain't life funny. Mark Just wait till the wife asks if you need any panty sheilds from the store Mine has a sense of humor I guess.

Posts.Title: Just joined the club

Posts.Content: Went to have my cath removed today. Hadn't heard anything from them about the pathology yet so I asked the nurse. She checked and told me I had negative margins and nothing in the lymph nodes. I still want to hear it from the doc but looks good so far. Now on to the fun part of my day - Cath came out fine and I went home feelin good about the pathology. Had lunch and then tried to take my first pee. Holy Crap!!!! I went straight to my knees in pain. Worst cramps I've ever had in my life. I couldn't move much less get back to the docs office. Had to call an amulance to help me get back there. Things settled down a bit and they reinstalled the cath. Said I'd need another week and then try again. Back home now and feeling fine and very happy with what I think is a good path report. Other than this little hiccup with the cath things are lookin good.
Posts.Title: I week Post Op update

Posts.Content: Congratulations on the great report.
Posts.Title: Week after surgery update

Posts.Content: 06/02/2013 - <0.01 Don't think I can complain about this.
Posts.Title: 6 Week Post Op PSA

Posts.Content: 06/02/2013 - <0.01 Don't think I can complain about this.
Posts.Title: 6 Week Post Op PSA

Posts.Content: Gonna throw a foot note here incase anyone else has this particular problem in the future. Got the cath out for the second time today and all is well. I could only find 1 other case of this happening on this forum and nothing anywhere else. Seems to be rare and is fixed by spending another week or so with the catheter. This was true for both my case and the other one here. Also no cases where this continued past 2-3 weeks.
Posts.Title: Bladder Spasms After Cath Removal - Incredible Pain

Posts.Content: Just thought I'd see if anyone has any feedback on this one. After having my cath removed yesterday I went home just fine. On my first attempt to urinate I was hit with the most incredible pain I've ever felt in my life. I was literally on my kness shaking and sweating and couldn't even get to the car to get help. Ended up having to call an ambulance to get me to the ER. I rode to the hospital on my knees curled up in a ball and hanging on the the gurney. Once there, things settled down enough eventually that they could recath me and after that I went back to normal in an hour or so. Has anyone else exeperienced this? They're going to leave the cath in for another week and try again but I don't want to go through this again.
Posts.Title: Bladder Spasms After Cath Removal - Incredible Pain

Posts.Content: Well, tomorrows the big day. Cath comes out at 10:00am for the second time. Been a little over 2 weeks since surgery. I sure hope I have better results this time. I'm not leaving the docs until I urinated several times this go around. Wish me luck All else is well so far.
Posts.Title: Bladder Spasms After Cath Removal - Incredible Pain

Posts.Content: Glad to hear it went well. Hoping for a good report for ya
Posts.Signature: Age 52 PSA 1.5 2012 DRE suspicious for last 2 years 3 biopsies over 2 year period - diagnosed PC on 3rd biopsy - Feb 2012 Davinci April 22nd 2012 UCSD Moores Neg margins, seminal and lymph - Organ confined Final Gleason 4+3 PSA May 2012 <.01
Posts.Title: Da Vinci Complete

Posts.Content: I think this is sort of like the evening news. You mostly hear the bad stuff but rarely the good. Try googling this term "% of men cured by prostatectomy" Yes, there can be side effects all of which are treatable. Yes, PC could possibly reoccur. Yes, there are other treatments with similar stats. I'm 52, 5 weeks out of surgery and all systems are go for me. And, I have a lot less anxiety knowing that my prostate is on the bottom of the ocean somewhere. Quote from Dr. Walsh: "The bottom line of this long-term study," concludes Walsh, "is that surgery cures the vast majority of men with tumors that are confined to the surgical specimen. Fortunately, today with improved means for early detection, this means that most men diagnosed with prostate cancer can be cured with surgery."
Posts.Title: Information from Women only forum, what do you think?

Posts.Content: Glad to hear it went well. Hoping for a good report for ya

Posts.Title: 10 Weeks Now

Posts.Content: Can someone explain this pump thing to me in better detail. I've seen a few discuss it but not sure what it is or where to get it. I'm having surgery in 3 weeks and still trying to get all the post-op info I can.
Posts.Title: The Pump

Posts.Content: This might sound a bit but harsh but it sounds like you need to stop feeling sorry for yourself. There's someone out there for each and everyone of us and sitting on your butt feeling sorry for yourself is doing nothing to improve your chances of finding that special person just waiting for you to come along. You've been given the gift of life and it would be a shame to waste it. Pull yourself up and get started. Even if it's small steps at first. Go for a walk with the dogs. Turn that into a jog. Then keep improving yourself a little each day. You have to be ready when the good stuff starts to happen. jim
Posts.Title: 2 years after surgery. single and the effects of surgery related impotence

Posts.Content: Welcome to the site. Hopefully, you won't become a full-fledged member. If you do, there's a lot of good advice and support here for ya.
Posts.Title: New Member from Pensacola

Posts.Content: This might sound a bit but harsh but it sounds like you need to stop feeling sorry for yourself. There's someone out there for each and everyone of us and sitting on your butt feeling sorry for yourself is doing nothing to improve your chances of finding that special person just waiting for you to come along. You've been given the gift of life and it would be a shame to waste it. Pull yourself up and get started. Even if it's small steps at first. Go for a walk with the dogs. Turn that into a jog. Then keep improving yourself a little each day. You have to be ready when the good stuff starts to happen. jim

Posts.Title: The Pump

Posts.Content: First off, your man is very lucky to have a girl like you. I can only offer what I would like if in his place and it might not be what works for him. Simply take the bull by the horns so to speak and be in charge. There are lots of options and they can be very fun. You may need to find out what those options are and get the ball rolling. I can think of no man shy or otherwise that wouldn't be receptive to this approach

Posts.Title: 9 weeks out...

Posts.Content: Awesome news !!!! Congrats
Posts.Title: 9 weeks out...

Posts.Content: I just wanted to say thanks to everyone here. This forum has been a lifesaver for me personally. My surgery is Monday at noon. From the first time I got the good news I had PC until now it's been a rollercoaster in my head. Fear, anxiety, sadness, you name it I felt it. I'm in a good place now as it seems the last step is acceptance and then let's get it done. The wife is onboard and I'm very fortunate to have a good woman behind me whatever the outcome. Highlander, Sarg, Gunny and even Blank you guys are awesome !!!!! Thank you all and I'll try and update this post from my smart phone as best I can during my exorcism. jim
Posts.Title: Surgery Monday :)

Posts.Content: My last PSA before surgery was 1.5. Didn't really care about that. Wanted the cancer out of me. Glad it is now and I hope it stays that way. It only takes one of those little cancer cells to get away and you're screwed. Also, at 50 while not 100% certain, the odds are very much in your favor to have a good outcome from surgery if you have a good surgeon.

Posts.Content: Congrats
Posts.Title: One week post-rad prost surgery!

Posts.Content: I have: Christopher Joseph Kane, MD Chief of Urology Professor of Surgery UCSD He's done over 1300 DaVinci surgeries so I guess he's had enough practice to make me feel cmfortable that he won't kill me on the table. hahaha All kiddin aside. I think or at least they tell me, I'm fortunate to be in my position with this. It helps some but still, when they tell ya you got cancer, it scares the crap outa me. Everytime I get a little pain I think " Shit, it's the cancer spreading " or, I worry that they'll find a bunch more other types of cancer when they get in there. It's not a constant fear or unbearable but it is messin with my head a little. Of course, they also gotta tell ya that you might not have sex anymore and that sucks. But who's gonna want to have sex with me if I'm peeing all over myself and wearin a diaper anyway. That's some of the crap that goes through my head right now. Vodka seems to be helping though.
Posts.Title: Guess I'm in this Elite Group now.

Posts.Content: Got the news a few weeks ago. I'm 52 and fairly healthy. They've been doing PSA tests and this was my 3rd biopsy. 12 cores, 4 positive 3+3 1% 3+3 5% 4+3 1% 3+3 15% Going in for surgery April 22 Been doing a lot of homework and discussing with doctors. The biggest problem I have is what's going on in my brain. It keeps tryin to scare the crap out of me.
Posts.Title: Guess I'm in this Elite Group now.

Posts.Content: PSA Results: 2008 - 0.90 2011 - 1.41 2012 - 1.91 - feb 2012 - 1.88 - May 2012 - 1.56 - Nov. I didn't do good on the PCA3 test and my dad had Prostate cancer also. He didn't die from it though. I figure taking a shot at cure is the best option for me even if it means I have to give up sex in the worst case scenario.
